instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard and trackpad disappeared after boot
threads.message:
Hi, i have a problem with a Macbook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Keyboard and trackpad work perfect if i push option button at start : can select drives, enter wifi key and move the trackpad. After boot OS they both disappeared and appear the windows where i have to connect a bluetooth keyboard or mouse. 
Things done :
- changed <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>
- changed <CHIP>U4830</CHIP>
- changed <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>
- changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7979</TRANSISTOR>
- changed <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>
All resistor and capacitors around these chips have correct values.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard and trackpad disappeared after boot
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum.

Check <RESISTOR>R4902</RESISTOR>-04.
Post <CHIP>U4910</CHIP> voltages, when macOS booted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard and trackpad disappeared after boot
threads.message: You are the number one ! It had a fall after boot on the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> due to a corrosion quite invisible. Thank you very much !
